edu.biu.scapi.primitives.trapdoorPermutation.cryptopp

Class CryptoPpRabinPermutation

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.primitives.trapdoorPermutation.TrapdoorPermutationAbs
      • edu.biu.scapi.primitives.trapdoorPermutation.cryptopp.CryptoPpRabinPermutation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RabinPermutation, TrapdoorPermutation

    public final class CryptoPpRabinPermutation
extends TrapdoorPermutationAbs
implements RabinPermutation
    Concrete class of trapdoor permutation for Rabin. This class wraps the crypto++ implementation of Rabin permutation.
    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

      • setKey

        public void setKey(java.security.PublicKey publicKey)
            throws java.security.InvalidKeyException
        Initializes this Rabin permutation with public key. After this initialization, this object can do compute but not invert. This initialization is for user that wants to encrypt a message using the public key but deosn't want to decrypt a message.
        Specified by:
        setKey in interface TrapdoorPermutation
        Overrides:
        setKey in class TrapdoorPermutationAbs
        Parameters:
        publicKey - - public key
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if the given key is invalid for this Rabin permutation

      • isElement

        public TPElValidity isElement(TPElement tpEl)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                              java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Checks if the given element is valid for this Rabin permutation
        Specified by:
        isElement in interface TrapdoorPermutation
        Parameters:
        tpEl - - the element to check
        Returns:
        TPElValidity - enum number that indicate the validation of the element There are three possible validity values: VALID (it is an element) NOT_VALID (it is not an element) DONT_KNOW (there is not enough information to check if it is an element or not)
        Throws:
        - - IllegalStateException if a key has not been set
        - - IllegalArgumentException if the given element is not CryptoPpRabinElement
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given element is invalid for this permutation
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • generateRandomTPElement

        public TPElement generateRandomTPElement()
        This function generates a random Rabin element while ensuring that the value obtained is relatively prime to the modulus.
        Specified by:
        generateRandomTPElement in interface TrapdoorPermutation
        Returns:
        TPElement - the created element

      • generateTPElement

        public TPElement generateTPElement(java.math.BigInteger x)
                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a Rabin Element based on the x value if the x value is valid for this permutation.

        If it succeeds, it is guaranteed that the element returned is a valid Rabin Element for this Rabin permutation instance.

        Specified by:
        generateTPElement in interface TrapdoorPermutation
        Parameters:
        x - an integer value to set as the value of the Rabin element
        Returns:
        a Rabin Element based on the cryptoPP library suitable to use with this permutation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if keys aren't set
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the x value is not a valid value for this trapdoor permution
        ScapiRuntimeException - if there is not enough information (trapdoor) to create this element

      • generateUncheckedTPElement

        public TPElement generateUncheckedTPElement(java.math.BigInteger x)
        This function returns a "possible" RabinElement based on the x value.

        No validity checks are performed on the x value so it is the caller's responsibility to make sure that the x value passed is a valid one.

        It is possible to call the isElement(TpElement) function on the object returned by this function if eventually validity checks are needed.

        Specified by:
        generateUncheckedTPElement in interface TrapdoorPermutation
        Parameters:
        x - an integer value to set as the value of the Rabin element
        Returns:
        a possible Rabin Element
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if keys aren't set.
